conclusion: Analyze the cyclic process of an ideal gas shown in a p-V diagram.
Temperature at state A is given as 27°C, which corresponds to 293 K.
State A is at 27°C, state C is at a higher pressure, volume at state A is 3 L, and at state C, it is 4 L.
Calculate temperature at state C using ideal gas law: PV = nRT.
Calculate number of moles n using ideal gas law: n = PV/RT.
Calculate work done by gas from state C to state D as difference in internal energy.
Internal energy at state C is U_C = nRT_C.
Internal energy at state D is U_D = nRT_D, and since T_D = T_C, U_D = nRT_C.
Calculate work done: W = U_D - U_C = nRT_C - nRT_C.
Since work done is zero, the work done by the gas from state C to state D is zero.
